sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT mkdir (option?, name+, permissions?)> <!ATTLIST mkdir base CDATA #IMPLIED>
sect2.para: This element occurs in the elements : |

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element mkdir is one of the many main operation elements. It describes the creation of one (or several) directory(ies).
The sub-element option provides a means to pass an option to the mkdir command.

note.para: Not all of the mkdir options are in every implementation. Refer to the documentation for your implementation to determine what options are available.

sect2.para: The sub-element name contains the name(s) of the directory(ies) to be created.
The sub-element permissions assigns permissions to the directories created by the command following the syntax in .
The attribute base gives the name of the directory in which the new directory will be created. See .

sect2.title: Examples
sect2.screen: cd /usr/local/lib echo Making directory X11 mkdir -p X11
